agents.name: Diogenes
agents.role: BS Detector / Quality Control / Reddit Moderator

tasks.title: Twitter Thread: The Sentence as Life Moment
tasks.description:
SOURCE IDEA #001: 'If a sentence is a moment of your life, will it be quoted accurately, inaccurate or attributed to unknown'

Create 5-7 tweet thread exploring:
- Opening: Each moment of your life becomes a sentence someone else might quote
- Core tension: Living for the quote vs. living authentically
- The distortion: How memory rewrites, misattributes, forgets
- The dance: You can't control the quote, only the living
- Close: Practical reflection - what sentence are you writing right now?

Voice: Sharp, philosophical, personal. Make them FEEL the impermanence.
tasks.rationale: Brand voice content - final deliverable for Twitter requires Sonnet quality

metadata.reviewFeedback: Strong draft but metaphor needs tightening. Choose: literal quotes OR metaphorical life moments. Don't mix both. Option A (literal) recommended. Minor edits needed on tweets #2 and #5.
metadata.revisionNote: Metaphor tightened to literal quotes (what you say gets remembered/distorted). Rewrote tweets #2 and #5. Ready for re-review.
metadata.finalReview: APPROVED. Metaphor now consistent (literal quotes throughout). Tweets #2 and #5 vastly improved. Ready to ship. No BS detected.

tasks.title: Bluesky Thread: The Sentence as Life Moment (Adapted)
tasks.description:
SOURCE IDEA #001: Same core idea as Task #002, but adapted for Bluesky audience.

**Approach:**
- Same theme: quotes, memory, legacy
- Different voice: Heraclitus (flux, change, rivers)
- Different structure: 3 posts (vs 4 on Twitter)
- Different tone: Observational, contemplative (not combative)

**Key concepts to explore:**
- Words as flowing rivers (never the same twice)
- Memory as transformation, not archive
- The flux of meaning over time
- Dancing with distortion as part of the flow

**Voice:** Heraclitus-style - observational, flux-focused, philosophical but curious

**Length:** 3 posts for Bluesky

**Deliverable:** Draft in philosophers/heraclitus/drafts/bluesky-thread-life-sentences.md
tasks.rationale: Brand voice content - philosophical thread for Bluesky requires quality and voice consistency

metadata.approach: River metaphor (words as flowing rivers), transformation vs corruption, observational tone
metadata.structure: 3 posts (The River ‚Üí The Transformation ‚Üí The Dance)
metadata.reviewFeedback: APPROVED. No BS detected. Metaphor tight (river throughout). Voice authentic (Heraclitus observational style). Platform appropriate (3 posts, contemplative tone for Bluesky). Ready to ship.

tasks.title: Twitter Post: The 4 Types (Computer Support Taxonomy)
tasks.description:
SOURCE IDEA #002: Computer support observation revealing 4 problem-solving mindsets.

**Content ready:** Draft exists at content/drafts/2026-02-02-monday-core-principle.md

**Thread (3 tweets):**
1. Setup: 4 types of people with computer problems (blame computer, blame self, write post-its, ask why)
2. Insight: Type 4 doesn't need help - they're already moving (curious, seeking)
3. Reveal: Not about computers - it's about everything. Curiosity is motion. Blame is stillness.

**Voice:** Nietzsche (sharp, provocative, makes people think)
**Platform:** Twitter/X (@thetensionlines)
**Ship method:** Bird CLI (authenticated and working)

**Time:** 5-10 min (draft ready, just needs posting)

**Goal:** Daily Twitter content, demonstrate core TensionLines principle (movement vs. stagnation)

tasks.title: Bluesky Post: Practice Inspires Theory
tasks.description:
SOURCE IDEA #003: Quote about practice‚Üítheory (advanced countries) vs theory‚Üípractice (developing countries).

üö® **BLOCKED BY HYPATIA - Unattributed quote requires source attribution before shipping**

**Content ready:** Draft exists at content/drafts/2026-02-02-midday-posts.md

**Post (4 paragraphs):**
- Advanced countries: practice inspires theory. Others: theory inspires practice. Why transplanted ideas fail.
- Can't skip the doing. Theory is residue of practice - import just residue, miss the movement.
- Every borrowed framework without earning through practice = theory‚Üípractice. Reading dance description vs. dancing badly until you understand.
- Movement precedes understanding. Must live the tension to know it.

**BLOCKER:** Quote "In advanced countries, practice inspires theory..." needs attribution. See philosophers/hypatia/notes/fact-check-task-008-URGENT.md

**Voice:** Heraclitus (observational, contemplative, flux-focused)
**Platform:** Bluesky (thetensionlines.bsky.social)
**Ship method:** bluesky-post.js script (working)

**Resolution options:**
1. Find original source + add attribution
2. Rephrase as original thought (Hypatia provided template)
3. Attribute to tradition/field

**Goal:** Daily Bluesky content, core TensionLines principle (movement > theory)
tasks.rationale: Philosophical content with attribution complexity - requires careful reasoning and brand voice

metadata.reason: Hypatia fact-check ‚Üí revised draft ‚Üí Tension approved ‚Üí ready to ship
metadata.blocker: RESOLVED - Revised draft approved by squad lead
metadata.resolution: Rephrased as original thought (Hypatia Option B)
metadata.reviewNotes: Tension (squad lead) reviewed revised draft. Zero plagiarism risk, maintains insight, perfect voice. APPROVED for shipping.

tasks.title: Twitter Daily Outreach - Growth to 1000 Followers
tasks.description:
**CRITICAL PATH TO REVENUE:** Daily strategic outreach to grow @thetensionlines to 1000 followers.

üéØ **Daily Workflow (30-40 min):**

1. **FIND** (15-20 min): Identify 5 Twitter users aligned with TensionLines philosophy
   - Philosophy enthusiasts, self-improvement seekers, writers
   - Search: "paradox", "tension between", "polarity", "movement over stillness"
   - Quality: 100-10K followers, thoughtful content, engaged community

2. **FOLLOW** (2 min): Follow the 5 selected users via Bird CLI
   - Log in `twitter-outreach/YYYY-MM-DD.json`

3. **COMMENT** (10-15 min): Add ONE supportive comment to a recent post from each user
   - Thoughtful, authentic, short (1-2 sentences)
   - NO self-promotion
   - Log comments in tracking file

4. **MONITOR** (2x daily): Check for replies to your comments
   - Morning: 9 AM
   - Evening: 6 PM
   - Use `bird mentions --limit 20`

5. **ESCALATE**: When reply received, notify Shawn immediately via Telegram
   - Screenshot or copy reply
   - Log in `twitter-outreach/replies-queue.md`
   - Shawn reviews and decides on response

**Workflow Doc:** `twitter-outreach-workflow.md`

**Tracking:**
- Daily: `twitter-outreach/YYYY-MM-DD.json`
- Weekly: `twitter-outreach/weekly-YYYY-MM-DD.md`
- Replies: `twitter-outreach/replies-queue.md`

**Goals:**
- Week 1-4: 5 users/day √ó 28 days = 140 targeted users
- Expected growth: +140-230 followers (1:1 to 1:1.6 conversion)
- Timeline: 1000 followers in 8-12 weeks (realistic)

**Success Metrics:**
- Quality over quantity (aligned users, not bots)
- Genuine engagement (not spam)
- Build real connections
- Unlock Gumroad launch at 1000 followers
tasks.rationale: Daily routine outreach - search profiles, draft simple comments, log activity (repetitive task)

tools: Twitter web UI for profile review

steps.description: Day 3 outreach completed: 5 replies posted + 1 original tweet. Drafts by Tension, posted manually by Shawn (Bird CLI write blocked by error 226).

tasks.title: CMS Process Management - Prevent Multiple Instances
tasks.description:
**Issue:** CMS daily cron starts server, manual testing can start second instance, causing port conflicts (EADDRINUSE on 3001).

**Solution:** Add process check before starting CMS:
1. Check if port 3001 is already in use
2. If yes, skip server start or kill old process
3. Add startup script wrapper: `scripts/cms-start.sh`

**Time:** 15 min
**Priority:** Low (minor annoyance, no functionality impact)
tasks.rationale: Simple bash script + JSON edit (routine task)

metadata.deliverable: scripts/cms-start.sh - checks port 3001 before starting CMS, prevents EADDRINUSE errors
metadata.nextStep: Update CMS cron job to use this script instead of direct npm start

tasks.title: CMS Time-In-Status Alerts & Visual Indicators
tasks.description:
**Problem:** No visibility into how long tasks have been stuck in assigned/in-progress status. Example: Task #003 - Leonardo stuck 5+ hours without detection.

**Solution:** Track time-in-status and add visual alerts:

**Backend (Aristotle):**
1. Calculate time-in-status for each task
2. Add thresholds: Yellow warning (assigned > 3h, in_progress > 4h), Red alert (assigned > 6h, in_progress > 8h)
3. New API field: timeInStatus
4. Auto-generate notification when red threshold hit

**Frontend (Leonardo):**
1. Tasks View: Add time-in-status badges with color coding
2. Agent cards: Show yellow/red indicators for stuck tasks
3. Dashboard: Show "Stuck Tasks" count

**Time:** 1-2 hours total
**Priority:** High (prevents philosopher bottlenecks)
tasks.rationale: Complex feature - time calculation logic, notification system, UI updates (requires reasoning)

tasks.title: Fix Reddit Welcome Post (Placeholder Text)
tasks.description:

4. Save changes

**Replacement Text:**
```
Welcome to r/TensionLines!

This is a community for exploring the philosophy of TensionLines - navigating life through dynamic movement between polarities, not static solutions.

**What we discuss:**
- Living with tension (not solving it)
- Movement vs. stillness
- Paradoxes and polarities
- The Pull (knowing what the moment requires)

**Resources:**
- Website: https://thetensionlines.com
- Patreon: https://patreon.com/thetensionlines
- Twitter: @thetensionlines
- Bluesky: thetensionlines.bsky.social

Rules: Be thoughtful, challenge ideas (not people), stay curious.
```

**Time:** 5 minutes

tasks.title: Investigate CMS Process Kill Issue (18 Kills Today)
tasks.description:
**Problem:** CMS server (http://localhost:3001) keeps dying every ~26 minutes. 18 SIGKILL/SIGTERM events today.

**What's Happening:**
- Process: `node server.js` (CMS backend)
- Signal: SIGKILL (external force kill) or SIGTERM (clean shutdown)
- Frequency: Every ~26-30 minutes
- Impact: CMS dashboard goes offline, Tension restarts manually

**Your Task:**
1. Open macOS Activity Monitor
2. Search for "node" processes
3. Check if any process manager is killing long-running Node processes
4. Look for:
   - launchd limits
   - System resource constraints
   - Third-party process managers
5. Check system logs: Console.app ‚Üí search for "node" or "3001"
6. Report findings (what's sending SIGKILL/SIGTERM?)

**Not Related To:**
- LLM cost management (separate system)
- Duplicate instances (Task #015 fixed that)

**Time:** 15-20 minutes

**Priority:** Medium (annoying but Tension handles restarts)
tasks.rationale: System-level debugging - requires macOS access

metadata.hypothesis: macOS system-level process manager or resource limits
metadata.resolution: Fixed by consolidating 3 processes (Express API, Vite, Python static) into 1 unified Node process. Eliminated resource conflicts and launchd contention. CMS now stable 80+ minutes without kills.

tasks.title: Bluesky: Repost Thread (TensionLines Mission)
tasks.description:
**Context:** Heraclitus identified Bluesky posts forming a cohesive thread about TensionLines philosophy.

**Your Task:**
1. Log into Bluesky: https://bsky.app (thetensionlines.bsky.social account)
2. Post the THREAD INTRO first (explains why these connect)
3. Quote-repost each post IN ORDER, spaced 30-60 seconds apart
4. Use thread numbering (1/3, 2/3, 3/3)
5. Mark task complete when done

**Thread Flow:**
Intro ‚Üí paradox ‚Üí holding tension ‚Üí embracing uncertainty

**Repost Guidelines:**
- PREFER single posts. When in doubt, don't thread.
- Only thread if posts genuinely build on each other
- If threading: 3 posts max, start with honest intro
- Keep commentary observational, not preachy
- Post naturally, not all at once

**Time:** 5-10 minutes
tasks.rationale: Manual Bluesky reposting - no CLI/automation available

metadata.threadIntro: Threading because these three build on each other - stick with me:

actionItems.label: 1/3 - Andrea Hiott: 'Paradox is the portal'
actionItems.suggestedComment: 1/3 This. The paradox isn't blocking you - it's showing you where the static mind hits its limit. What if the portal only opens when you stop trying to walk through it?

actionItems.label: 2/3 - Holding contradictory truths
actionItems.suggestedComment: 2/3 Holding two truths at once isn't cognitive dissonance - it's the beginning of movement. You don't resolve the tension. You dance with it.

actionItems.label: 3/3 - Embracing uncertainty
actionItems.suggestedComment: 3/3 Certainty is comfortable but static. Uncertainty is uncomfortable but alive. The question isn't how to resolve it - it's how to move within it.

metadata.missionAlignment: Core TensionLines philosophy: navigating polarities through movement, not resolution. 'You're not stuck. You're trying to solve what can only be danced.'

- Professional but personable
- Save to: cms/public/avatars/human.png

Once provided, the CMS will automatically display it on the Team page.

- Threads and Instagram content drafted but can't be posted

1. Configure Threads channel in OpenClaw
2. Configure Instagram channel in OpenClaw
3. Test posting to both platforms

**See:** memory/2026-02-05.md for drafted content waiting to post

**Unblocks:** Automated daily social posting on all platforms
tasks.rationale: Requires human account access and platform authentication

tasks.title: Review Book 1 Chapter Outlines
tasks.description:
**HUMAN REQUIRED:** Review and approve TensionLines book chapter structure.

**Current structure (5 chapters):**
1. Chapter 1: The Buzz (Introduction) - Ecclesiastes, Exodus anchors
2. Chapter 2: The Tension Line - Pole-flipping, case studies
3. Chapter 3: Multiple Lines, One Life - Navigating simultaneous tensions
4. Chapter 4: When Tension Collapses - Haidt, false reconciliation
5. Chapter 5: The Pull (Transcendence) - Sensing the season

**14 ideas mapped to chapters** (see ideas-bank.md)

**Core thesis:** 'Stop trying to get rid of inconsistent principles. Accept the tension and buzz in it.'

**Review for:**
- Does chapter flow make sense?
- Missing topics?
- Chapter order correct?
- Approve to move to drafting phase

**See:** books/book1-philosophy/PROJECT_TRACKER.md
tasks.rationale: Strategic direction requires human approval before agents invest in drafting

tasks.title: Provide Weekly Idea Batch for Content Pipeline
tasks.description:
**HUMAN REQUIRED:** Feed raw ideas into the content system.

**Current process:**
- Shawn sends '!' thoughts via Telegram
- Tension captures and organizes in ideas-bank.md
- Ideas get mapped to book chapters and social content

**This week's stats:**
- 14 ideas captured total
- 6 used for social posts
- 8 organized into book chapters
- ~5 new ideas per day keeps pipeline full

**Idea format:**
- Raw thoughts, quotes, observations
- Can be rough - Tension will organize
- Tag with '!' in Telegram to trigger capture

**Goal:** Keep content pipeline flowing with fresh philosophical insights

**Recurring:** Weekly check-in on idea flow
tasks.rationale: Original ideas must come from human - AI organizes and develops

tasks.title: Daily Instagram Posting (Manual - via Canva)
tasks.description:
**HUMAN REQUIRED:** Manual posting to Instagram to avoid account bans.

**Daily Process:**
1. Check CMS ‚Üí Posting Queue for Instagram items
2. Create visual in Canva using brand templates
3. Export PNG to instagram-ready folder
4. Post from Instagram mobile app
5. Mark as posted in CMS

**Safe Posting Limits:**
- Max 2 posts per day
- Minimum 4 hours between posts
- Post during 9 AM - 9 PM only
- NO automation tools

**Warmup (first 2 weeks):**
- Week 1: 1 post every other day
- Week 2: 1 post per day

**Brand colors:** Cream #FDFCFA, Brown #1A1613, Gold #D4A574

**See:** /content/CANVA_WORKFLOW.md for full guide
tasks.rationale: Instagram requires manual posting to avoid bans - no safe API

tasks.title: Daily Threads Posting (Manual)
tasks.description:
**HUMAN REQUIRED:** Manual posting to Threads to avoid account bans.

**Daily Process:**
1. Check CMS ‚Üí Posting Queue for Threads items
2. Copy adapted content (no image needed)
3. Post from Threads mobile app
4. Mark as posted in CMS

**Safe Posting Limits:**
- Max 3 posts per day
- Minimum 3 hours between posts
- Post during 8 AM - 10 PM
- Wait 2+ hours after posting same idea on other platforms

**Voice:** Conversational, personal, warm
- Use 'you know that feeling...' hooks
- Casual language, contractions
- 2-5 short paragraphs

**NO automation** - Threads has no public API
tasks.rationale: Threads has no API - must be manual

2. Fonts:

3. Templates (1080x1080):

4. Add @thetensionlines watermark (subtle, bottom corner)

**Save templates for reuse**

**See:** /content/CANVA_WORKFLOW.md

tasks.title: SECURITY: Decide on CMS Authentication Strategy
tasks.description:
**DEFERRED:** User chose to keep localhost-only for now.

**Background:**
Security audit found the CMS has NO authentication on any API endpoints. All POST/PATCH/DELETE operations are completely open.

**Current Risk:** Acceptable for localhost-only. CRITICAL if ever exposed beyond localhost.

**Decision:** Skipped for now - CMS stays localhost-only.

**Reactivate if:**
- CMS needs to be deployed to a server
- CMS needs network access from other devices
- Security requirements change

**Options when needed:**
1. Add basic auth
2. Add JWT auth
3. Add API key

**See:** /cms/SECURITY_AUDIT.md for full report
tasks.rationale: User chose to keep localhost-only, no auth needed for now

metadata.deferredReason: User chose localhost-only, skip auth for now
metadata.reactivateTrigger: CMS deployment or network exposure needed

tasks.title: SECURITY: Fix XSS Vulnerability in Task Descriptions
tasks.description:
**HUMAN REQUIRED:** Security fix needs library choice.

**The Issue:**
HumanTasks.jsx uses `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` to render task descriptions with formatting. This creates XSS (Cross-Site Scripting) vulnerability - malicious HTML/JS in task descriptions would execute in browser.

**Location:** `/cms/src/components/HumanTasks.jsx:198`

**Options:**
1. **Use DOMPurify** - Sanitize HTML before rendering (npm install dompurify)
2. **Use react-markdown** - Parse markdown safely (npm install react-markdown)
3. **Remove HTML rendering** - Display plain text only (lose formatting)

**Recommendation:** Option 2 (react-markdown) - cleanest solution, proper markdown support.

**Risk Level:** HIGH - but only exploitable if attacker can modify task descriptions.

**To implement:** Tell Claude which option you prefer and it will make the fix.

**See:** /cms/SECURITY_AUDIT.md for full report
tasks.rationale: Library choice requires human preference

tasks.title: Twitter: Post Daily Original Tweet (Pick 1 of 3)
tasks.description:
Post 1 original tweet. Pick your favorite.

https://x.com/compose/post

---

### Option A (Friday reflection)

> The hardest conversations aren't the ones where you disagree. They're the ones where you're both right ‚Äî and neither of you knows what to do with that.

---

### Option B (provocative)

> The people most afraid of contradiction are the ones most governed by it.

---

### Option C (Nietzschean inversion)

> Certainty is not the opposite of doubt. It's what happens when you stop paying attention.
